reference.scope: VARIANTS [LARGE SCALE ANALYSIS] PHE-69; GLU-275; GLU-388; ALA-655; MET-659; LEU-991; ARG-1197; GLU-1221; LEU-1246; MET-1304; THR-1463; ALA-1468; GLY-1551; ARG-1673 AND GLU-1703

comment.text: Appears to link the dystrophin/utrophin network with microtubule filaments via the syntrophins. Phosphorylation of DMD or UTRN may modulate their affinities for associated proteins. Functions in a multi-protein complex in spermatid maturation. Regulates lipopolysaccharide-induced IL-12 synthesis in macrophages by forming a complex with TRAF6, resulting in the inhibition of TRAF6 NF-kappa-B activation (By similarity).
ATP + a protein = ADP + a phosphoprotein.
Recruited to the sub-membranous area on interaction with CDHR2.

Phosphorylated and ubiquitinated. N-terminal ubiquitination leads to degradation of MAST2 by proteasome-mediated proteolysis. N-terminal phosphorylation appears to be a prerequisite for ubiquitination (By similarity).
Belongs to the protein kinase superfamily. AGC Ser/Thr protein kinase family.

feature.description: In an ovarian mucinous carcinoma sample; somatic mutation.
In a breast mucinous carcinoma sample; somatic mutation.
